original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Kusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ🔽hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ hetuṁ

translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca naakusalo nahetu ca naabyākato nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ🔽hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nahetu ca naakusalo nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.

translated: With a wholesome cause as condition there arises a non-wholesome, causcless state. With a wholesome cause as condition there arises a non-wholesome, causcless state. With a wholesome cause as condition there arises an indeterminate, causcless state. With a wholesome cause as condition there arise a non-wholesome, causcless state and an indeterminate, causcless state. With a wholesome cause as condition there arise a non-wholesome, causcless state and a non-wholesome, causcless state.

translated: With an unwholesome cause as condition there arises a non-wholesome, causcless state. With an unwholesome cause as condition there arises an indeterminate, causcless state. With an unwholesome cause as condition there arises a non-wholesome, causcless state and an indeterminate, causcless state. With an unwholesome cause as condition there arise a non-wholesome, causcless state and a non-wholesome, causcless state.

original: hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ hetuṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ

translated: With an unwholesome cause as condition, a wholesome state not caused by a cause arises. With an unwholesome cause as condition, a neutral state not caused by a cause arises. With an unwholesome cause as condition, a wholesome state not caused by a cause and a neutral state not caused by a cause arise. With an unwholesome cause as condition, a wholesome state not caused by a cause and an unwholesome state not caused by a cause arise.

translated: With a neutral cause as condition, a wholesome state not caused by a cause arises. With a neutral cause as condition, an unwholesome state not caused by a cause arises. With a neutral cause as condition, a wholesome state not caused by a cause and an unwholesome state not caused by a cause arise. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate terasa
translated: With a cause, there are thirteen. With object, there are nine. … With nutriment, there are three. … With faculty, there are three. … With path, there are three. … With Nibbāna, there are three. … With an unwholesome root, there are three. … With a neutral root, there are thirteen. … With a condition, there are thirteen. … With an unwholesome condition, there are thirteen. … With a neutral condition, there are thirteen.

original: Paccanīya
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: In reverse order

analyzed: na ārammaṇa  kusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: Not object condition🔽With respect to the unwholesome, the unwholesome is related to the wholesome by way of object condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā terasa …pe… napurejāte terasa …pe… navippayutte nava …pe… novigate nava.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)

translated: (The section on the origination through the condition being together and the section on the origination through the condition being related should be expanded in the same way as in the section on condition being cause.)

original: Kusalaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: With a wholesome, rootless state as condition, an unwholesome, root-caused state arises, by way of root condition. With a wholesome, rootless state as condition, an indeterminate, root-caused state arises, by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha nava.)

translated: In the section on root condition, there are nine possibilities in the section on object condition, there are nine possibilities … in the section on kamma result condition, there are three possibilities … in the section on non-hindrance condition, there are nine possibilities. (In all sections, nine possibilities.)
